You're right, the speed and volume of news on Twitter can indeed be overwhelming at times. With real-time updates and a constant stream of information, it's easy to feel like you're being bombarded with news and are unable to keep up.

To manage the information overload on Twitter, you might consider using tools like lists, hashtags, and filters to organize the content based on topics and interests. Additionally, you can follow specific accounts or news organizations to ensure that you're receiving relevant and trustworthy information.

It's also important to take a step back and prioritize your own mental health and well-being. If you're feeling overwhelmed, it's okay to take a break from Twitter or limit your time spent on the platform.

Ultimately, while Twitter has undoubtedly changed the way we consume news, it's up to each individual to decide how best to manage the flow of information and stay informed without becoming overwhelmed.
